question: 申し申し
sourceMnemonic:
It's kind of like you're saying <kanji>say</kanji> <kanji>say</kanji>, and it’s used in classical Japanese to get someone’s attention, so this is <vocabulary>excuse me</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>hello</vocabulary>.

You would generally encounter <ja>申し申し</ja> in dialogues set in older times, unlike its modern, shortened version <ja>もしもし</ja>, which is used for telephone greetings (and almost always written in kana).
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the reading you learned with the kanji. You should know it already.
